intro: Bistorta diopetes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bistorta, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible rhizomes. The plant features upright, slightly hairy stems that bear alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a reddish underside. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense spikes, and are typically greenish-white in color. Bistorta diopetes is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
